intro: Albizia pentzkeana, commonly known as the pink albizia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Albizia pentzkeana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural use in gardens and landscapes.
